column4: I am not getting the mod_rewrite voodoo to work, any Apache2 witch doctors in the house?
Yeah, apache2ctl is not complaining but nothing is working. *sigh*
what does the error log say (and more importantly pls define _what_ you want to achieve with mod_rewrite....)
Error log says nothing, access log says '200'
I want mod_rewrite to move useragents that begin with the string 'Java' to someplace off my server
then enable the rewrite log (RewriteLog /path/to/file - RewriteLoglevel 9 - apache2ctl -t && apache2ctl restart)
The rewrite log is already enabled as far as I can tell, I put that in /etc/apach2/apache.conf
can you paste that? along with your rewriterule?
Here is the condition: RewriteCond %{HTTP_USER_AGENT} ^Java
And here is the rule: RewriteRule  ^/$ /glossary.html  [L]
try  RewriteRule  ^/$ /glossary.html  [R,L]  (you are aware that ^/$ only matches if you request http://yourserver/ - and nothing else?)
Yeah, that is what I wanted, any user agent with ^Java should get redirected.
you will only redirect any user agent with ^Java that requests ^/$
Hmm. So if one requests ^/foo$ it does not get redirected.
I see.
I was not clear on that.
Thanks for the clarification.
no $ says end here so you to redirect everything you would do ^(.*) /glossary.html
Okay, I will edit my requesting script and watch the logs again . . .
Hmm. No go. I must have put the directives in the wrong place.
No go. I think the syntax is alright, I just feel I have the rewrite rule in the wrong place.
